title: Bond 25, No Time To Die, gets earlier UK release date
text:
Daniel Craig will play 007 one final time (Picture: Universal)

The UK release date for the 25th James Bond film, No Time To Die, has been moved up a day to 2 April 2020.

The film, starring Daniel Craig as spy 007, was originally scheduled to hit cinemas on 3 April in the UK and 8 April in the US, but has been bought forward a day by producers.

The new release date was revealed on global James Bond Day which also saw the release of a new poster, showing Craig looking all kinds of moody in Bond’s signature tux and gazing intensely at something in the distance, probably a Bond girl or a villain he plans to take down.

No Time To Die will be Craig’s last outing as Bond although the 51-year-old might not be quite ready to turn his back on the spy, after he made an emotional speech at the wrap party while bidding goodbye to the team.

According to reports, the dad-of-two made a drunken speech at the bash, telling director Barbara Broccoli and the gang just how much he would miss them all after filming came to an end in Italy in September.

James Bond has no time to die (Picture: Universal)

‘I just want to say, and I am really quite drunk now so I won’t go on for long, this has been the best, most wonderful experience I have ever had,’ he told the gang who were gathered in what appeared to be a restaurant.

‘You have all done the most amazing job. I could not be more proud to work with every single one of you.’

‘I would like to thank you for this evening, for Barbara, for putting it on,’ he added in a clip shared to Twitter, filmed by a member of the gathering.

‘Thank goodness, we did this tonight.’

Daniel has been joined by a string of famous faces, including Rami Malek and Lashana Lynch in the upcoming instalment, with Naomie Harris and Ben Whishaw returning to the fold.

There has been intense speculation over just who would be stepping into his tux next – with Richard Madden, Idris Elba and Tom Hiddleston among those tipped for the role.

No Time To Die is released in UK cinemas on 2 April, 2020.
